verses.verse: With gladness and rejoicing they shall be brought; They shall enter the Kingâ€™s palace.
Instead of Your fathers shall be Your sons, ((1 Pet. 2:9; Rev. 1:6; 20:6)) Whom You shall make princes in all the earth.
(Mal. 1:11) I will make Your name to be remembered in all generations; Therefore the people shall praise You forever and ever.

(God the Refuge of His People and Conqueror of the Nations) To the Chief Musician. A Psalm of the sons of Korah. A Song (1 Chr. 15:20) for Alamoth. [1] God is our (Ps. 62:7, 8) refuge and strength, ((Deut. 4:7; Ps. 145:18)) A very present help in trouble.
Therefore we will not fear, Even though the earth be removed, And though the mountains be carried into the midst of the sea;
((Ps. 93:3, 4)) Though its waters roar and be troubled, Though the mountains shake with its swelling. Selah
There is a ((Ezek. 47:1-12)) river whose streams shall make glad the (Ps. 48:1, 8; Is. 60:14) city of God, The holy place of the tabernacle of the Most High.
God is ((Deut. 23:14; Is. 12:6); Ezek. 43:7; Hos. 11:9; (Joel 2:27; Zeph. 3:15; Zech. 2:5, 10, 11; 8:3)) in the midst of her, she shall not be moved; God shall help her, just at the break of dawn.
(Ps. 2:1, 2) The nations raged, the kingdoms were moved; He uttered His voice, the earth melted.
